list_definition.definition: a small devil or wicked spirit.

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: Her son is a little imp.

list_ex_of_english: Pinel was unable to achieve much for him, and appears in the book as a servant of the imps.
And these devil clowns can in turn trace their ancestry to the imps and tricksters of folk performance and ritual.
The two imps tie up all loose ends with their cosmic powers.
On its south wall is a squint with a carved image, known as the church imp, who looks through the squint.
She was an imp of mischief from commencement to conclusion.
That imp sits on his shoulders very often, but there must have been one on each shoulder when he designed this wretched, mean and despicable tax on the poor children.
The imps of mischief have been at work to-day.
While appearing as a diminutive imp monster, her actual form is human-shaped.
